fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a workflow is setup with multiple approvers required, the issue stays in the approval status until the requisite number of approvers have approved or declined the issue and the issue transitions to the corresponding status.

The *Waiting for my approval* option on the portal seems to be looking at the issue status and not whether the current user needs to provide a response.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a workflow with an approval status
 # Configure said status to have 2 or more approvals
# Approve the issue on one account
# Review the *Waiting for my approval* page on the portal of another approver of that same issue

h3. Expected Results
The issue disappears when the user viewing the *Waiting for my approval* page.

h3. Actual Results
The issue remains until approved by the requisite number of approvers or is declined.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Waiting for approval shows issues that the user has already approved

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4867].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, we can manage Service Desk customer list by adding user group into the Service Desk project's {{SERVICE DESK CUSTOMERS}} role. 

But to manage customers on the Organization level, we will need to add user one by one which is not an efficient way of maintaining the list when there is a huge change in the company's user management.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow Service Desk's Organization to accept user groups.
fields.summary: Allow user groups to be added into Service Desk organization

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Pre-filled value is not working for components field

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a request type that has a _components_ field as a visible field
# Create a custom URL passing a default value for the select list
{noformat}
servicedesk/customer/portal/8/create/47?summary=test&components=COMPONENTS_OPTION_ID
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results

You should be able to submit the request just fine.

h3. Actual Results

Despite the value is shown on the select list, when we try to submit the request the field value is blank and the user needs to manually select the field value. 

h3. Workaround
Select field value manually
fields.summary: Pre-filled value is not working for components field

fields.description:
Currently, there are tools to import object schemas from the standalone cloud app into JSM Premium's built-in Insight: https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/import-an-object-schema/


However, there isn't a similar option for Server Insight. It'd be very helpful to have a dedicated process from Server -> Cloud imports of Insight.
fields.summary: Provide a way to properly import Server Insight schemas and objects into JSM Insight

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When assigning a request directly from the queue page, automation rules that are configured with "Multiple issue events" and have "Issue assigned" as one of the events are not triggered.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an automation rule with the trigger "Multiple issue events" and select "Issue assigned as one of those events".
 # Publish the rule.
 # Assign a request by clicking the Assignee field in the queue and selecting an agent. 

 !example.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The automation rule is triggered.

h3. Actual Results
The automation rule is not triggered.

h3. Workaround

Use the "Issue assigned" or "Field values changed" trigger instead.
fields.summary: Assigning a request from the queue does not trigger an automation rule with the trigger "Multiple issue events"

fields.description: It would be a great feature for the admins to have the ability to show the confirmation screen before an agent can reply to the customer in the comments. Currently, [this|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1217337/doublecheck-for-jira-and-service-desk?hosting=server&tab=overview] add-on can do the job but it is not available for Cloud Platform.
fields.summary: Show confirmation screen before replying to customer

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The rest endpoint */objectconnectedtickets/[OBJECT_ID]/tickets* to get connected Jira tickets for an Insight object, does by default exclude +resolved+ tickets. However, these are filtered +after+ the subset for the pagination is done – which could result in +unresolved+ tickets being not included. Max limit is 50. 

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a Jira instance with JSM Premium and Insight enabled
 # Create a test object in Insight
 # Setup an Insight custom field and configure it to make the test object available for selection
 # Create 51 tickets where that Insight object is selected in the custom field
 # Go to the test object and click _Show all filtered issues_
 # You should see ticket 1-50, which is correct behaviour so far since the limit is 50 and all tickets are unresolved.
 # Go and resolve ticket 3 and 4 – then repeat step 5
 # You will now only see 48 tickets, and ticket 51  is not included

h3. Expected Results

Given a list with tickets like below, and we want the first 5 +unresolved+ tickets – we are supposed to get TICKET-1, TICKET-2, TICKET-5, TICKET-6, and TICKET-7.
{code:java}
* TICKET-1 (unresolved)
* TICKET-2 (unresolved)
* TICKET-3 (resolved)
* TICKET-4 (resolved)
* TICKET-5 (unresolved)
* TICKET-6 (unresolved)
* TICKET-7 (unresolved)
* TICKET-8 (unresolved)
* TICKET-9 (unresolved)
* TICKET-10 (unresolved){code}
h3. Actual Results

Given a list with tickets like below, and we want the first 5 +unresolved+ tickets – we are currently getting only 3 tickets back that are TICKET-1, TICKET-2, and TICKET-5. 
{code:java}
* TICKET-1 (unresolved)
* TICKET-2 (unresolved)
* TICKET-3 (resolved)
* TICKET-4 (resolved)
* TICKET-5 (unresolved)
* TICKET-6 (unresolved)
* TICKET-7 (unresolved)
* TICKET-8 (unresolved)
* TICKET-9 (unresolved)
* TICKET-10 (unresolved){code}
h3. Workaround

The workaround today is to use the [iqlFunction|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/insight-jql-functions/] in JQL to get the correct result of connected Jira tickets.
fields.summary: Rest endpoint to get connected Jira tickets for an Insight object does not filter unresolved tickets before subset is created

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When an associated/responder alert comes from an Incident it displays the impacted-services ID. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
N/A

h3. Expected Results
The name of the service should be displayed
h3. Actual Results
The service ID is used on the alert.

h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: When an associated/responder alert comes from an Incident it displays the impacted-services ID.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary:

Double Approval and decline button in the Approval email notification. This double-entry of Approval group on ticket history only appears if the agent enters the group from the Agent view using "*Add 1 approver*" button under the status of the request:

 

!Screenshot 2021-10-27 at 12.40.36 PM.png|width=271,height=143!  
h3. Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create Group from user management page

2.Add the Approvers groups field to Create/edit/view screen of the issue type.

3. Configure Approval configuration and select Approval groups field for the issue type.

!image-2021-10-27-12-43-16-392.png|width=140,height=123!

4. Create the issue add the Approvers group. From the history, we see that the group is added twice and hence triggering double notification(4 buttons) for the users in the group.

!Screenshot 2021-10-27 at 12.49.57 PM.png|width=260,height=62!

5. Double Approval and decline button in the Approval email notification for the user:

!Screenshot 2021-10-27 at 12.46.13 PM.png|width=152,height=101!
h3. Expected Result

Approval notification should have one Approval and Decline button.
h3. Actual Result

When the approval group is entered from the Agent view using "*Add 1 approver*" button under the status of the request, double-entry is logged in the history of the ticket and the approval notification is triggered twice.
h3. Workaround:

Suggests to add the Approver group while creating the ticket or add it directly into the group picker field configured for approval.
fields.summary: Double Approval and decline button in the Approval email notification

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Insight fields do not come up as a selectable option for the following gadgets:
 * Pie chart
 * Workload pie chart
 * Two dimensional filter statistics
 * Issue statistics
 * Heat map

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Insight field
 # Go to a dashboard and add one of the gadgets listed above
 # Try to set it up to use your Insight field as a source of data

h3. Expected Results

The custom Insight field is selectable in the dropdown list.
h3. Actual Results

The custom Insight field does not appear in the dropdown list.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Insight field is not available to be selected on some dashboard gadgets

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Rest API `/rest/servicedeskapi/request` to get request always returns the same statusDate as createdDate.

[https://atlassian.slack.com/archives/CFHTXKE23/p1635263454076400]

API doc: [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/api-group-request/#api-rest-servicedeskapi-request-get]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a request from JSM project
 # Update the request status
 # Use API `/rest/servicedeskapi/request` to query for the request

h3. Expected Results

In request's field `currentStatus.statusDate`, the value should be the time for status transition.
h3. Actual Results

Value request's field `currentStatus.statusDate` is not following the status transition time, instead of it sticks to the same value as field `createdDate`. 
h3. Workaround

A workaround is making an additional call to the [customer request status API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/api-group-request/#api-rest-servicedeskapi-request-issueidorkey-status-get] to get a list of statuses a request has achieved, in reverse chronological order.
fields.summary: Rest API to get request always returns the same statusDate as createdDate

fields.description:
Currently Jira Service management allows the customer to complete the CSAT survey multiple times, therefore ,allowing the customer to change his score and comments at any time.

Looking for ability to restrict/limit the survey to be taken only once
h3.
fields.summary: ability to prevent taking CSAT survey more than once

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users have the option to handle Missing objects during their import. They can set an attribute to be updated to a new value for objects that weren't part of the current import.

If the attribute to be updated was an object reference then the new value must be an objectId. If that objectId is deleted the import will fail.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up the configuration of an import (any kind)
 # Edit the configuration and set Missing objects to Update
 # Set the attribute to edit option to an attribute that is a reference type
 # Set the `New value of attribute to edit` to an objectId that exists (validation will force this)
 # Save the configuration and delete that object corresponding to the objectId in step 4
 # Run the import and see the failure

h3. Expected Results

The import would complete successfully with errors
h3. Actual Results

The import fails to import objects and errors out.
h3. Workaround

Make sure before you run the import or after you get this error to fix the `New value of attribute to edit` to an objectId that exists.
fields.summary: Deleting the object that was supposed to be used as the new value in an updateMissingObjects action causes index out of bounds exception when import is executed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Customer reporting custom field ´Impact´ was created by him according to the audit log but claims he didn't create it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Not been replicable but below are the steps that should reproduce it. However, [~a620038e6229] could confirm in this [Slack thred |https://atlassian.slack.com/archives/CFJ8DQZT8/p1635123780013600]he could already see 2 *Impact* fields in his instance.
 # Go to a test site
 # Enable JSM product
 # Create a project *ITSM-1,* and the *Impact* field should be created.
 # Create another JSM project *ITSM-11* with the option *Share settings with an existing project* and choose *ITSM-1* for it

h3. Expected Results

The existing *Impact* field should be used
h3. Actual Results

Another *Impact* field was created
h3. Workaround

Remove the duplicate and assign the existing field manually.
fields.summary: Custom field ´Impact´ is mysteriously created

fields.description:
h3. Current behavior
Currently there is a visual discrepancy between how the *Create Issue* screen and *View/Edit Issue* screens display the *Select List (multiple choices**)* custom field. This causes an inconsistent feel when interacting with the user interface.

Ideally the look and feel of these fields should align. System fields such as *Components* appear different to the custom field equivalent on the *Create* screen and the *Transition* screen as noted in the screenshots attached.

h3. Desired outcome
Ideally we would want to see the same style applied throughout the different screens to give a consistent look and feel for these fields.
fields.summary: Align create issue screen style with view/edit screens

fields.description: Ability to have fields to fill automatically the preconfigured values for summary and description when customer selects certain field in the request form
fields.summary: option to create template for fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you search for group names in a group-type Insight attribute, the search is case sensitive.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In User Management, create a group called *Group-1*
 # In Insight, create an object schema and then an object type
 # Create an attribute of type *Group* for that object type
 # When creating an object for that object type, click on the group-type attribute field
 # Search for group *Group-1* by typing *gr, gro, grou,* or *group* but the group will not come up in search

h3. Expected Results
Group name search should not be case sensitive.

h3.Actual Results
Group does not show up unless typed with the case sensitivity it has in it's name.

h3. Workaround
Search the group name with exact case sensitivity as per the group name
fields.summary: Group name search in Insight group-type attribute should not be case sensitive

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

During Insight object editing/creation when we lookup values in a group-type attribute, it shows *Showing 10 of total 10 groups* even when there are more than 10 groups. This is misleading.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure there are more than *10* groups in *User Management*
 # In Insight, create an object schema and then an object type
 # Create an attribute of type *Group* for that object type
 # When creating an object for that object type, click on the group-type attribute field

h3. Expected Results

It should show *Showing 10 of total 20 groups* if the total number of groups is 20.
h3. Actual Results

Shows *Showing 10 of total 10 groups*
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Insight group-type attribute shows "Showing 10 of total 10 groups" even when there are 10+ groups available

fields.description:
Would love to see an integration with CrowdStrike's Workflows to send an Webhook

https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Opsgenie-questions/How-to-create-and-API-alert-via-CrowdStrike-Webhook/qaq-p/1788832

https://www.crowdstrike.com/blog/tech-center/notification-workflows/
fields.summary: OpsGenie Integration: CrowdStrike Webhook

fields.description:
h3. Problem

While using a Team managed project, it isn't possible to hide the workflow statuses from customers in the customer portal as we can do for company-managed projects.

Snippet from company managed projects:

!Screenshot 2021-10-22 at 7.14.32 PM.png|width=424,height=195!

Suggested resolution

Add the ability to hide workflow statuses in the customer portal for next-gen/team-managed projects.
fields.summary: Ability to hide workflow statuses from customer in customer portal for next-gen/team-managed projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

While creating a duplicate project by selecting "share settings with" some functionalities do not getting copied
 * the Germans translations are not copied in the new project
 * the email request does not get copied

h3. Suggested Resolution

Copy the portal contents while creating a new project using shared configuration.
fields.summary: Copy portal contents while creating a project with shared configuration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Edit Issue automation action does not add the full array of objects on a smart value

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two object types (OT1 and OT2) and an Insight Object custom field for each object type
 # On the first Object Type, add an Object attribute that holds more than one object from the second Object Type;
 # Create an OT1 object with 2 or more objects from OT2 on the attribute above
 # Create an automation that uses the Edit Issue action like so:
 #* Key in ({{{{customfield_99999.Attribute}}}})
#* !image-2021-10-21-16-12-54-310.png|thumbnail! 
 # Execute the automation

h3. Expected Results
The automation adds all OT2 objects from the OT1 attribute into the field created for OT2

h3. Actual Results

N-1 objects are added. ie if there is four objects on the attribute, three are added to the field.

*Note* If you add the same smartvalue from step #5 into a "Log Action" action, the correct amount (ie "N") of keys is listed.

h3. Workaround

The following syntax should workaround the above behavior:

{code}
Key in ({{#issue.customfield_99999}}{{Attribute}}{{/}})
{code}
fields.summary: Edit Issue automation action does not add the full array of objects on a smart value

fields.description:
Note - the component field is required on this form, but there wasn't a matching component.  This is about ProForma, not Insight.

Using ProForma has been great for creating forms with dynamic fields.

Unfortunately, unless we map every ProForma field to a Jira field, they are not searchable.

Example:  A new server request uses ProForma fields, in which server names are entered.  Someone wants to search for a request based on the server name.  Since it's not linked to a Jira field, it is not possible.

Now that Atlassian owns ProForma, I'm hoping there can be a fix for this.
fields.summary: JQL search on ProForma form fields

fields.description:
Some incorrect contents found in the [Export data from Insight Discovery to Insight Cloud|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/export-data-from-insight-discovery-to-insight-cloud/] page:
 * Under the *Configure Insight Discovery* section:
 ** Step 4. Insight Discovery will generate a data file containing detailed information about your network and the devices in it. That file will appear in the ‘-Import- {color:#00875a}Scan{color}' folder.
 * Under the *Configure Insight for Jira Service Management* section:
 ** Step 6. In the ‘Create Insight structure or Import configuration?’ screen, select Close. Because the import connection will automatically create a structure and configuration for the data it receives from Insight Discovery, you can simply exit this screen.
 ** {color:#00875a}The above steps may not work all the time. In case it fails, the user may still need to create both structure and configuration first before proceeding.{color}
fields.summary: Rectify Incorrect Information in Export data from Insight Discovery to Insight Cloud page

fields.description:
Please add `rescheduled` and `removed` as scheduled incident / maintenance status fields. 

Sometimes we plan maintenance pretty far in advance. Before the window hits, we may find the maintenance is unnecessary or needs rescheduling. Currently, there is no way to "revoke" a maintenance window. The only way we can do it is to "close as completed with a comment" which feels wrong.
fields.summary: [StatusPage] update enum for scheduled maintenance

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When disabling or revoking access from a User on Opsgenie, all the users with the Admin/Owner roles will receive a notification about the action being done and the affected user.

h3. Suggested Solution
Give the Admins the ability to decide who will receive these notifications.
fields.summary: Add the ability to Admins decide who will receive administrative notifications from Opsgenie

fields.description:
Connect a JSM to Azure to make regular checks on infrastructure and import configuration data about my infrastructure.

Atlassian has Insight to : https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1218974/insight-azure-integration?hosting=datacenter&tab=overview
 But this plugin is only available for Server.

Currently, we do not support any integration in Insight. We only support CSV Import.
fields.summary: Azure Integration for Insight Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a group name contains *"&"* character, the name is not searchable with that character in a *group-type* attribute during object editing or creation.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In User Management create a group with *"&"* in it's name. *For example: F&B*
 # In Insight, create an object schema and an object type
 # Add a *Group* type attribute to that object type
 # While creating an object in that object type, search for the group name with *"&"* in the *Group* type attribute

h3. Expected Results
The group name should be searchable with the *"&"* character

h3. Actual Results
The group name is not searchable with the *"&"* character

h3. Workaround
Search with any other character in that group name. Probably better to search with the exact name or most part of it.
fields.summary: Searching with "&" doesn't find the name in a Insight group-type attribute if the group name contains "&"

fields.description:
This is an enhancement request for the JSM issue view related to 'JRACLOUD-36896 Limit User Picker to members of certain groups/roles in System Fields. It would be very useful if after selecting the organization we could only select the clients of that particular organization in the reporter field.

Currently, we cannot limit the users appearing in the reporter dropdown of certain criteria.
fields.summary: limit reporter dropdown to show only the customers from the selected organization(s) in the organizations field

fields.description:
Hi team,

Sometimes the users would like to have this capability to customize the Email notifications to increase the readability and let the responders easily catch up with the important information, and also to include some of the fields parsed from the source integration side to the Email notification body.

This will be very helpful.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Ability to customize notification emails for Opsgenie

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently Insight is available only for Enterprise and Premium plans of Jira Service Management(JSM).
h3. Suggested Solution

Insight should be available for JSM Standard and Free plans too.
h3. Why This Is Important
 - Customers with JSM standard and free plans will be able to experience Insight.
 - Larger user base for Insight

h3. Workaround

Customers willing to try Insight can sign-up for [JSM Premium Trial|https://www.atlassian.com/try/cloud/signup?bundle=jira-service-desk&edition=premium]
fields.summary: Availability of Insight for Jira Service Management free and standard plans

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using cascading fields(using [Filter issue scope|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/configure-the-insight-object-field/#Use-the-Filter-Issue-Scope--IQL--field]), the dependent field value doesn’t get removed automatically when the master field value is changed. This will lead to incorrect data in Jira issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 2 Insight object custom fields: *Country* and *City*
 # Master field: *Country* and Dependent field: *City*
 # For *Country* value *Italy*, the *City* values are *Venice*, *Rome*
 # For *Country* value *Germany*, the *City* values are *Berlin*, *Bonn*
 # In *Country* field select *Italy* and in dependent field *City* set *Rome*.
 # Change the *Country* to *Germany* but the *City* field still shows *Rome* unless manually changed.
 # In this case if the *City* value is not changed and you continue with ticket creation, the Jira issue will end up with wrong data. *Country: Germany* ; *City: Rome*

h3. Expected Results

The depended field *City* should be cleared out automatically as soon as the master field *Country* is changed.
h3. Actual Results

The dependent field value does not get cleared automatically.
h3. Workaround

Once the master field value is changed, click on the small cross icon in dependent field to clear the existing data. Then click on the dropdown to see the available dependent values for the changed master field value.
fields.summary: Insight: When using cascading fields, the dependent field value doesn’t get removed automatically when the master field value is changed

fields.description:
Currently, if a reporter with an external email address directly reports into the system, that email address is entered as the reporter.

But, if someone internal to the system creates a ticket on behalf of an external reporter, there is apparently no way to make that external reporter's email address the reporter in the ticket.

Moreover, neither can external email addresses be added to the "request participants" field.

This situation is suboptimal.
fields.summary: Add ability to add external email addresses to reporter and request participants fields

fields.description:
h3. Problem

The *Unique* feature when set for more than 1 attribute in an object type should work in combination. Like creating a combination of primary keys in database table. Currently the way *Unique* feature works is that if you enable it for an attribute, every value of that attribute will be unique in that object type. If one object has that attribute value of *abc*, then *abc* can't be set for that attribute in any other object of that object type.
h3. Suggested Solution

There should be an option to enable *Unique* feature for 2 or more attributes of an object type and those 2 or more attributes could be used in combination. Something similar to a combination of primary keys in database table.
h3. Why This Is Important
 - For large environments having a single attribute limits the creation of a unique CI(Configuration Item). This in turn severely puts a limit on what all can be imported.
 - Helps in environments with multiple domains and assets where the same hostname/application name can exist multiple times. For example: The combination of a Software/Application asset with the combined key of Name + Environment (PROD/DEV/TEST/...). Here the application will exist multiple times but only once in combination with the environment.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Ability to have a combination of unique attributes in Insight

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Currently there is no option to have predefined values in attribute field during object. In Insight, when you click *Create object* and the Create Object window opens to enter the values(manually), some fields should already have a default/preset value which can be changed or left as is during object creation.
h3. Suggested Solution

There should be an option to set predefined values for attribute fields during object creation.
h3. Why This Is Important
 - Saves time during object creation. Especially helpful when there are many objects to be created with same values in multiple attribute fields.
 - Prevents human error during object creation in large number as there would be lesser fields to be filled

h3. Workaround

Use Automation for Jira. *When: Object created*, *Action: Edit object*
fields.summary: Ability to have preset values in attribute field during Insight object creation

fields.description:
I have set the domain record correctly on our domain. The mail we received is always said the sender could not be verified. The mail is not able to show correctly content.

 

How could I fix it?
fields.summary: Outgoing mail issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The *Due date* field saves the date like the following in the instance database:
{code:none}
2021-10-19T00:00:00Z
{code}

In the issue view, this shows correctly as *Oct 19* (e.g., for a user in *GMT-6* and the instance timezone set to *GMT-5*), but the portal view for that same user shows as *Oct 18* instead of *Oct 19*. This seems to be due to the portal trying to account for the user's timezone and subtracting the timezone offset from the entry in the database.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set the *Due date* field in a ticket in the issue view
 # Configure the *Due date* field to be visible
 # View *My requests* page and toggle the *Due date* field
 # Observe that the field shows a different date than what it shown in the issue view (e.g., issue view shows *Oct 19*, but portal shows *Oct 18* or *Oct 20* depending upon the customer's time zone)

h3. Expected Results
The portal view shows the intended date.

h3. Actual Results
The timestamp from the database is taken into account and the timezone offset for the user viewing the ticket is subtracted from that timestamp resulting in the incorrect day being shown.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Due date field on portal My Requests page shows incorrectly

fields.description: It's inconvenient to use sub-task forms b/c the issue view can not be changed b/c we can not assign the subtask a request type. The views are not easily readable b/c the issue view can not be changed.
fields.summary: Assign Sub-Tasks a request type so that the Issue View can be changed

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, for user attributes, the data must use account id value. 

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be best if the admin can use their email address instead for an easier process to import user attributes.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround at the moment. Admin can get user Account Id from "Export User" file at User Management and update the CSV file accordingly.
fields.summary: Allow to use user email address when import user attribute in Insight

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Currently there is no way in cloud version to sync user information in JSM Insight, something similar to what is mentioned in [LDAP import in Server/DC|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagementserver/ldap-import-1044784485.html].
h3. Suggested Solution

Just like Server/DC version, LDAP import should be available for Cloud
h3. Why This Is Important
 - Feature parity between Server/DC and Cloud as mentioned in [here|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/what-are-the-differences-between-insight-in-cloud-and-server/]
 - Better integration with AD and other external databases

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: LDAP integration with Insight

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Project shortcuts are not available for agents without admin rights.
If the user has Jira license without agent rights then shortcuts are displayed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project with shortcuts
 # Access the project with an agent account 

h3. Expected Results
Shortcuts are displayed

h3. Actual Results
Shortcuts are missing

h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Project shortcuts are not available for agents without admin rights

fields.description: Currently it is only possible to sort the portals by alphabet or by popularity. We would like to have the flexibility to display the portals in a self-selected order.
fields.summary: More flexibility in the arrangement of the portals in the Main Portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem description
When an alert comes from an incident, it displays the impacted-services ID which is difficult to know which the actual impacted service is.

h3. Suggested solution
Add the service name to the alert so looking at it we could easily tell the associated impacted service
fields.summary: Add the Service Name (plain text) to associated alerts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user is invited/added using an email address with an *uppercase* letter and *special character,* this user will not be able to send a request type with an Insight field in Portal. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As an agent, in your JSM project, set up a request type that contains an Insight field.
 # Use the "Invite team" modal in the JSM project. Make sure the email contains *uppercase* letters and *a special character* like a quotation mark: {{'}} (e.g. {{Email+Is'Special@yourprovider.abc}})
 !image-2021-10-15-13-56-05-400.png!
 # The user will go through the signup process normally.
 # As the new user, go to the portal for the JSM project and select the request type in step 1.
 # Fill out the request type and click "Submit".

*Note:* There can be different ways of adding a user to cause this same problem but the one mentioned in the step is the current one we know.
h3. Expected Results

The request is to be submitted successfully and the user is redirected to the created request.
h3. Actual Results

The request is not created.

There is a 500 error in the Dev Console for the create request.

The request form does not indicate any errors. 
h3. Workaround

If the affected user is an Agent, they can create the issue in the Agent view.

If the affected user a Customer, we can work around this by removing [Filter Issue Scope|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Service-Management-articles/Announcing-Filter-Issue-Scope-for-Insight/ba-p/1737942] feature in Insight for this user. Please contact the Atlassian Support team to help you with removing this feature for the impacted user.
fields.summary: When user is invited using an email address with uppercase letter and special character, sending request with Insight field in Portal fails

fields.description:
*Current behavior*
Currently, when setting up an Insight field's filter issue scope, you're not able to use dot notation to return the value of an attribute, for example, ${customfield_XXXXX.attributeName} won't return anything.

*Desired behavior*
It would be great to have the ability to use dot notation to get an attribute's value inside the filter issue scope.
fields.summary: Add attribute dot notation functionality to Insight custom fields, within the filter issue scope

fields.description:
It would be great to have string manipulation functions similar to the ones available for [smart values|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/smart-values-text-fields/] for IQL.

For example, when using a placeholder like ${customfield_XXXXX.label}, you might want to manipulate the string value that is returned.

This is nice for setting up the filter issue scope of an Insight field for example.
fields.summary: Add IQL string manipulation functions

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Currently the *Graph* section of an object type does not have the option of *Tree View* like the one mentioned in [Viewing references in a graph|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagementserver/viewing-references-in-a-graph-1044784570.html]
h3. Suggested Solution

Just like Server/DC version, object type graphs should have the option of *Tree View*
h3. Why This Is Important
 - Better visibility and understanding for multi-level object schema 
 - Better manageability for nested object types.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Availability of Tree View in Object Schema graph in Insight

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The majority of agents (if not everyone) have mistakenly posted an intended internal note as a reply to customer. At least once in their career.
h3. Suggested Solution:

Make the background of the editor when typing internal note same colour as the internal note comment' s background. Like this:
!image-2021-10-14-10-58-50-751.png|width=354,height=155!

 
h3. Why this is important

Visual signals are the strongest ones for agents. The background colour is directly reminding the type of the comment to be sent. It will drastically reduce internal note sent as replies to customers.
fields.summary: Different background colour of the editor when typing internal note comment

fields.description:
When changing the permission scheme for JSM projects, the result is that the project administrator gets a warning that there are configuration problems. The project administrator gets the possibility to "repair the problem" (please see screenshot).

If he chooses the option to repair the problem a new permission scheme for the JSM project is created.

I would like to have the ability to change the permission scheme for JSM projects without the project administrator having the possibility to repair and to create a new scheme. 

!image-2021-10-14-08-47-24-346.png!
fields.summary: Change permission scheme without warning

fields.description: Linking a Service in JSM to a confluence page or Knowledge base article to define the service function and technology would be a great benefit for not only for the newly onboarded but also give the technicians and engineers scraping through incidents greater understanding not only of the relationships (which is awesome by the way) but the technical working and expected function.
fields.summary: Link JSM Service to Confluence page/Knowledge Base

fields.description:
Hi Team,

I saw the help text which defines what a "Service" is in JSM. In my opinion, defining "service = product or application" does not sound right from Service Management perspective. Especially when it pops up for a new user it may be confusing.

Hoping to have an updated version.

Cheers
fields.summary: Service Definition for JSM

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an object schema is deleted the object schema first disappears and display a successful badge/popup then the same object schema reappears after a browser refresh. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a object schema
 # Create and configure a import (you don't even need to run it)
 # Try delete the created object schema
 # Refresh the browser

h3. Expected Results

The object schema is deleted
h3. Actual Results

On UI we receive a confirmation message saying that the schema was deleted, but after refreshing the page the schema it's still there.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Delete an object schema silently fails

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When clicking on an attachment with the file type .msg in the request view of the customer portal, the following error is shown:

{noformat}
Something went wrong.

We couldn't generate a preview for this file.

Try downloading the file to view it.
{noformat}

It is possible to preview the file from the agent view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add an attachment with the file type .msg to a request.
 # Open the request in the customer portal.
 # Click on the .msg attachment.

h3. Expected Results
A preview of the file should the shown.

h3. Actual Results
The file is not previewed and an error is shown.

h3. Workaround
Download the attachment and open it in an email client.
fields.summary: Unable to preview .msg attachments in the request view of the customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently, the JSM Customer portal only shows the Object Name (label) while selecting and after saving the object in Insight Custom Field.  

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Add an Insight Custom field
# Add the field to any customer request form
# Create/View issue from the customer portal

h3. Suggestion:
For the Insight field, the selected attributes should be shown on the portal view page.

 !Screen Shot 2021-10-13 at 14.25.18.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add ability to see more object attributes on the customer portal view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, approvals smartvalues data are not treated in automation for Jira, and we can't iterate in them using [list functions|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/smart-values-lists/] or advanced branching features. See the example below of the {{{{approvals.approvers}}}} smartvalue:

!image-2021-10-12-18-26-07-441.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

Convert the approvals smartvalues to lists as they should be.
fields.summary: Approvals smartvalue data should be treated as list

fields.description: Similar to the postmortem for Incidents, I feel that Opsgenie could improve by having an on-call report associated to on-call rotations with free text fields as well as an auto-populated list of incidents handled. In addition, a Sevice Management integration could include tickets closed during the on-call period.
fields.summary: On-Call Report

fields.description:
The Responders field type, is not available for filtering with JQL, therefore, customers can't created Reports, Filters or anything that involves JQL, with the Responders field.

!image-2021-10-12-13-29-56-557.png! 
 !image-2021-10-12-13-31-35-145.png|width=452,height=362! 
 !image-2021-10-12-13-32-22-674.png!
h3. Current behavior

If you try to build a JQL with Responders field, either with its name or field ID, Jira will say that the field doesn't exist, therefore, being unable to filter by it.

User is able to add the column 'Responders', but not filter by it.
h3. Expected

It would bring a better experience if the customers could filter (JQL) by Responders field, since he can see the option available in columns
fields.summary: Make Responder Field Type supported by JQL

fields.description:
As an agency with several customers

I would like to restrict the access to a certain service management for the public and still be able to allow creating issues via mail

So that critical service management are not visible publicly and yet we can provide support directly in an issue that has been automatically created based on an email.
fields.summary: Split service management setting: create issue via mail/ display service management publicly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h4. New issue view:

In the New issue view, if you have a long SLA name it gets truncated and there is no tooltip to show the complete name of the SLA. 
 !image-2021-10-12-18-01-54-973.png!
h4. Old issue view:

The same SLA on the old view shows the full name of the SLA.
 !image-2021-10-12-18-02-07-365.png!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a SLA with a long name 
 # View the issue in the 'New Issue View' which has newly created SLA

h3. Expected Results

Even in the 'new issue view' complete SLA name should be displayed or there should be a tooltip to help the Agent view the SLA name.
h3. Actual Results

SLA name gets truncated at the end.
h3. Workaround

Currently only workaround is to use old issue view if available.
fields.summary: SLA name truncated on New Issue View

fields.description:
Hello,

I would like to suggest two different features that may be useful:
 * In the issue view, it would be nice to be able to change the size of the columns.
 * At the moment, we have the possibility to see the column "Created", which just shows the date. It would be nice to have the possibility to see the time, either in the same column or in a new one "Created Time".

!image-2021-10-12-12-37-53-026.png|width=750,height=124!

Thank you.
fields.summary: Re-size columns in issue view. Add a "Created Time" column.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In JSM portal request form date time picker is not able to parse custom time correctly in 12-hour format.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Step-1: Open a form that contains a date-time pickerr
 Step-2: Set the time in your Jira settings to use 12-hour format
 Step-3: Type any custom time like 06:27 PM
 Step-4: The time is not parsed correctly and we get the wrong time in the picker.
h3. Expected Results

The field shows the correct time as 06:27 PM.
h3. Actual Results

The time is not parsed correctly and we get the wrong time in the picker.
h3. Workaround

We can provide the time in 24 hours format from the keyboard and it will appear correctly in the field.
fields.summary: Issue in portal date time picker in parsing custom values in 12 hour format

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Users often create aliases to use in their JSM mail handlers and would like to be able to filter if a request was sent to the alias or the original mail handler address

h3. Suggested Solution
Add all the recipients existent in the message only during its creation to an issue property that could be retrieved later using automation with advanced conditions
fields.summary: Add the To/CC recipient lists to an issue property

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Currently the services are part of a separate object schema called *Services*. There is no option to have these in the same schema as other Insight objects. Also, it is not possible to create child object type for *Services* object type.
h3. Suggested Solution

There should be option to have the services in the same schema as any other Insight objects. Also, ability to create child object types for Services is important.
h3. Why This Is Important
 - Better manageability as one object schema can manage all object types
 - A regular object schema offers more granularity than *Services* schema

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Insight: Enhanced capability of Services object schema like regular schemas

fields.description:
Hello,

We have a number of Jira groups that were created before we started using JSM along with Atlassian Access and we sometimes see users assigning tickets to these old groups which are not synched from Access - is there any way to hide these groups from JSM - I know I can delete them but that will impact other Jira Software projects as well.

Thanks

Andy
fields.summary: Would it be possible to hide some user groups from being selected in JSM

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At the moment, it is not possible for user to import attachments and avatars from Insight Server to the JSM Insight Cloud

h3. Suggested Solution
Have an option for admin to import attachment and avatar to JSM Insight Cloud

h3. Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: Ability to import attachment and avatars from Insight Server to JSM Insight Cloud

fields.description: A user has to select an Issue Type before creating an issue from Jira Cloud mobile app. There should be an option to select *Request Types* for portal customers in a JSM project before creating a request from Jira Cloud mobile app.
fields.summary: Show Request Types to Service Management customers on Jira Cloud mobile app

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
At the moment, when a request type deleted , the existing issue that previously use the request type are not searchable when using :-

{noformat}
Request Type is Empty
{noformat}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create issue with Request Type A
 # Open the JSM project and delete Request Type A
# Search issue in issue navigator page , Request Type is Empty 

h3. Expected Results
The ticket are displaying in the filter results.

h3. Actual Results
Issue not displaying in the results even though in issue showing the request type is empty.

h3. Workaround

* Search issue using :-
{noformat}
Request Type not in ("Request Type B","Request Type C")
{noformat}

* Or , Create automation to clear the request type value and should be able to search using Request type is Empty
fields.summary: When delete request type , existing issue that used the request type can't be search using "Request Type is Empty"

fields.description:
Hi - we have some SDs that we want to use ONLY internally and now some new ones that are only for specific clients/orgs ... we have added all staff to a group and sync that group to a Company organization too that we added as a Customer on the 'internal SDs' - the problem we face is that the 'Share with' field displays and users may potentially select "Shaare with Company" - and that sends a notification to the whole org (out Company staff) - I would suggest the folllowing (knowing there may be internal or underlying changes for this) but it will help a great deal.
 * Have a org/site level configuration for all Organizations and all Customers in those organizations
 * Allow us to add Atlassian users or groups to the organization
 * Allow us to configure which SD projects have which Orgs and customers from an org/site level
 * Allow more configuration around the Share with field
 * Allow us to control notifications at organization level
 * Give us a better view of linking/understanding portal customers page and the org/customer lists

Thank you
fields.summary: Hide 'Share with' field

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the JSM [Insight REST API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/insight/rest/api-group-icon/] doesn't have an endpoint dedicated to adding/deleting object attachments like the Insight App had.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add the functionality for the Insight REST API to add/delete attachments.
fields.summary: Add Insight REST API attachment functionality

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When we add a comment to an issue with a table that has merged cells, the customer notification received by the customers does not have the table.
h3. Environment

JSM Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a comment to a ticket which has a table with a merged cell.
 # Save the comment so that the email notification is triggered to the customers 

h3. !image-2021-10-08-16-23-35-135.png|width=531,height=165!
h3. Expected Results

Customer receives the "Public comment added" notification that has that table
h3. Actual Results

Customer receives the notification but it does not contain the table.
h3. !image-2021-10-08-16-25-16-396.png|width=793,height=159!
h3. Workaround

_No workaround available at the moment_
h3. Notes

The internal Jira notifications are sent correctly that contain this table.
fields.summary: When an issue comment has a table with merged cells, the customer notification does not contain the table

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Inconsistency in order/sequence of how attributes are placed in object view. For example: if attribute-1 is placed 3rd from top in object-1, it is placed 4th in object-2. The objects, object-1 and object-2 are of the same object type.
 Check the attached PDF for better understanding.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an object type with 6-7 attributes
 # Create some objects with values set in all the fields
 # Browse through each object

h3. Expected Results

The sequence of attributes should be how those are placed in the Attributes tab and all objects in the same object type should have the same sequence.
h3. Actual Results

The sequence of attributes is not consistent for objects in the same object type.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Insight: Inconsistency in order/sequence of attributes in object view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira keeps asking other group members for approval even though the required number of group members have provided approval
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a multi-group picker custom field and
 # Configure approval on this multi-group picker field to require 1 approval per group
 # Add 
 ** *userA,userB* to group *G1*
 ** *userC* to group *G2*
 # Create a ticket with the groups G1 and G2 as approver groups
 # As *userA* approve the ticket. We now only require 1 approval from G2 group members now
 # Login as *userB* and view the ticket

h3. Expected Results

The ticket should no longer ask the *userB* for approval because the user1 provided the necessary approval from G1
h3. Actual Results

The ticket is still asking for approval from *user2* part of *G2*
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround at this time
fields.summary: Jira keeps asking other group members for approval even though the required number of group members have provided approval

fields.description:
h3. Problem description
At the moment, in Audit log when an account created whether for user with Atlassian Account or Portal only customer account it show created as a User. However, it doesn't specify which account type.

h3. Suggestion
It will be great to include that information in the audit log. For example *Portal only customer account created* , instead of User Created.

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Audit log on portal only customer account creation

fields.description:
h3. Scenario

When a new user sends an email to the non-public JSD Project (public signup for JIRA Service Desk is disable), it gets rejected. 
h3. Suggestion

Have an option to allow the JSD mail handler to create a new ticket from new customers' email using a default user as a reporter when public signup is disabled.
fields.summary: Allow JSD mail handler to create a ticket from new customers in non-public JSD Projects under default user.

fields.description:
h3. Problem description

Currently, when viewing an Insight object linked in a Jira issue, the order of the object attribute shown on the 'Object Detail' window does not reflect the order configured on the object schema.

 !Screen Shot 2021-10-08 at 14.15.55.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2021-10-08-14-17-20-381.png|thumbnail! 

The order of attributes displayed on the objects does not change and get reflected whenever the attributes are rearranged on the attribute configuration screen. Also, the attribute order on different objects can be randomly different, although the objects are under the same object type:

Example 2 objects under the same object type:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion
It will be best to show the object attribute on the 'Object Detail' window in the similar order that is configured on the object schema
fields.summary: Insight Object Attribute order on Object Detail should reflect the order configured in schema

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Issue: Customer experiencing slowness due to the IQL timing out. During investigation, we found that {{/iql}} endpoint is running just above 10seconds threshold (timeout)

Using the splunk log the particular IQL was isolated to

{{}}
 * {{object HAVING inboundReferences(objectType = Employee AND "Jira User"."Jira User" = \{userid})}}

The particular IQL above taking around 10 secs to execute

The problematic part of the IQL is the “Jira User”. “Jira User” where an object schema with attribute {{Jira User}} , the attribute of type {{User}} . The {{."Jira User"}} is accessing Jira user attribute on that user object requiring call to Jira.

The {{getUsersByBulk}} method in {{jsm-cmdb-monolith}} uses {{JiraClient}} to access {{Jira User}} attribute, the calls to Jira are batched with pagination value set to 50.

While 4.8 sec delay is less than actual timeout in the customer instance, it is an indication that these JiraClient calls are degrading performance. To help the customer we need to fix this pagination time to decrease the timeout and it can help towards uncovering other issues causing the additional delay observed in the customer instance.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to client site
 # Run
{code:java}
object HAVING inboundReferences(objectType = Employee AND "Jira User"."Jira User" = {userid}){code}
On instance with more the 3000 Jira user

h3. Expected Results

200 OK with pagination loading.
h3. Actual Results

504 Timeout 10 sec 400ms
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround for this case.
fields.summary: Customer experiencing slowness due to the IQL timing out

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you remove a user from a custom user picker field with the backspace/delete key or by clicking on the *X*, the removal will not be registered.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
[^Screen Recording 2021-10-07 at 10.22.58 AM.mov]

h3. Expected Results
The user picker field changes are applied.

h3. Actual Results
The user picker field changes are not applied.

h3. Workaround
If you specify a different user with "@UserNameHere" then clear it the edit(cleared field) does get saved.
fields.summary: Custom user picker field changes are not registered

fields.description:
Atlassian has Insight to Device42: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1219632/insight-device42-integration?hosting=datacenter&tab=overview
But this plugin is only available for Server.


Currently, we do not support any integration in Insight. We only support CSV Import.
fields.summary: Device42 Integration for Insight Cloud

fields.description:
Currently, Inbound references can be view in only detail view.

*Suggestion:*

It should be possible to see the inbound references on the list view, not only on the detail view.
fields.summary: Show inbound references in list view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When setting up **validators** for workflow transitions, using the *Field Required* validator, it's not possible to choose whether the comment visibility.

Ideally there should be an additional selection what the required comment field's visibility is either *public* or *internal*.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is a work around to create a legacy automation to trigger a request transition when a comment is added and the visibility can be restricted, however this will be applicable for all work flows that utilize those transitions.
fields.summary: Comment Visibility Option In Field Required  Transition Validator

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

An instance's mail handler may become unavailable during server downtime or a maintenance window. While queueing does exist, the mail server will attempt re-delivery without knowledge of whether the mail handler is available to receive the email.

In this scenario, a bounced email will be returned to the original mail server. On automated systems, a high volume of bounces may cause the origin mail server to block the email address preventing further emails even when the instance is up and running.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

The behavior can be reproduced when an instance is down or in maintenance mode.
h3. Expected Results
 * It would be beneficial if the queue had a defined re-delivery schedule before deciding to bounce the email.
 * Additionally the instance's mail handler could send a notification that it is back up and running to alert the queue to attempt re-delivery

h3. Actual Results

As described above, currently there will be an attempted re-delivery without the mail server [queue] being aware whether the instance mail handler is functional or not. This can result in a failed delivery again and an email bounce back to the mail origin server.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Improved email queueing when instance's mail handler is unavailable

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Ticket stuck in approval state after an approver is removed from one of the approval groups
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a multi-group picker custom field and
 # Configure approval on this multi-group picker field to require 1 approval per group
 # Add *user1* to group *G1* and *user2* to *G2*
 # Create a ticket with the groups G1 G2 as approver groups
 # As *user2* Approve the ticket, the approval is still required from *user1* in G1 
 # Remove the *user1* from *G1*
 # Refresh the ticket 

h3. Expected Results

The ticket should display a message that "1 more approval needed to proceed" showing the group that has approved and the group that is pending approval
h3. Actual Results

The ticket is stuck in a state "Submitting approval"
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Add *user1* back to *G1* and have them approve the ticket.
fields.summary: Ticket stuck in approval state after an approver is removed from one of the groups

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira keeps asking a user for approval who is removed from the approval group
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a multi-group picker custom field and
 # Configure approval on this multi-group picker field to require 1 approval per group
 # Add *user1* to group *G1* and *user1*,*user2* to *G2*
 # Create a ticket with the groups G1 G2 as approver groups
 # As *user2* Approve the ticket, the approval is still required from *user1* in G1 
 # Remove the *user1* from *G1*
 # Refresh the ticket 

h3. Expected Results

The ticket should no longer ask the *user1* for approval because the user1 does not exist in the G1 and approval for G2 is already provided by user2
h3. Actual Results

The ticket is still asking the *user1* for approval
 !image-2021-10-06-18-18-28-760.png|thumbnail! !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

If user1 decides to click on Approve, the ticket is stuck on "Submitting Approval"
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!

Adding *user1* back to G1 doesn't seem to fix the problem.
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround at this time
fields.summary: Jira keeps asking a user for approval who is removed from the approval group

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In team managed projects, while creating Jira automation rules, there are some fields that are unsupported in the dropdown to choose the fields. One such field is the 'User-picker' field. However, we are unaware of any other fields. There is no documentation that lists any of these details
h3. Suggested Resolution

Create documentation which lists the unsupported fields in the Jira Automation rule dropdown for team managed projects.
fields.summary: List of unsupported fields in the dropdown for team managed projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Sort queues on the fly by Cascading Select List fields

h3. Details
Tickets on Queues page can be sorted by clicking on field label in table header. However sorting is only supported for certain OOTB fields. 
This feature suggestion is to extend sorting ability to custom field of type 'Cascading select list'.

Note: User can sort using 'Cascading select list' field on advanced search by specifying it in 'order by' JQL clause or by clicking on field label in table header of search results.
fields.summary: Sort Queues on the fly by Cascading Select List fields

fields.description: Customer has requirement, where they want to Turn on CSAT by orgnization, currently we can enable for the entire Project.
fields.summary: ability to enable CSAT by Organization

fields.description:
When discussing problems in the comment field of an issue it would be great to be able to refer to (mention) Insight objects like a server in the CMDB or a customer in the CRM.

The mention should be visible from the Insight object as well so that you can trace back in which discussions the object has been mentioned.

We are currently implementing a CRM. In Insight we have all our customers (organisations and people). We use Jira to manage sales and want to record communication with customers as comments.

Our customers often have multiple issues going in parallell, sales discussions for new projects as well as requests and problems for existing services. Before you call a customer you want an easy way to quickly find out in what discussions the customer has been involved. Filtering out the issues where the customer is reporter or participant is too coarse and takes to much time.
fields.summary: Mentioning Insight objects in comments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When viewing a Service via the Insight Services schema any Jira issues that have been linked via the Affected services field do not appear under the Connected Jira issues section. Currently this is only populated if the Jira issue is linked via an Insight custom field.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a service (e.g. service-1) (via the JSM Services menu or within the Insight Services schema)
 # Create a new Jira issue and specify the service-1 within the Affected services field.
 # View service-1 within the Insight services schema.

h3. Expected Results

The Jira issue is listed under Connected Jira issues.
h3. Actual Results

The Jira issue is not listed. 
h3. Workaround

While the linked Jira issues do not appear within the Insight view, they do appear when viewing a service via the JSM Services menu.
fields.summary: Jira issues linked to a Service via the Affected Services field should appear as a connected Jira issue in Insight

fields.description:
h2. Summary
In team managed projects, when adding an approval step, it does not allow you to edit any existing 'Approval' field names

h2. Suggested Resolution
Allow to edit the Approval field name

h2. Workaround
There is no workaround. You have to create a new field.
fields.summary: Ability to edit Approval field name in Team-managed projects

fields.description:
h1. Summary

Currently, there is a lot of confusion between the field names Reporter, Requester and Creator on the customer portal.
 # When a customer raises a request, the customer name is displayed under all 3 fields:- Creator, Requester and Reporter
 # When an agent raises a request on behalf of a customer, the customer name is again displayed under all 3 fields:- Creator, Requester and Reporter

h1. Suggested Resolution
 # Add 'Reporter' field to the issue view in customer portal.
 # Both the current 'Requester' field and the Reporter fields can display the customer's name in both the above cases (when customer raises request and when agent raises request on behalf of customer).
 # Rename the Requester field on the Portal('My Requests' page) to be called 'Reporter'
 # Display the actual creator of the ticket as per any of these feature requests:
 ** https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-8978
 ** https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-3374

h1. Workaround

There is no workaround
fields.summary: Resolve conflict in naming convention between Reporter, Requester and Creator on customer portal

fields.description:
h1. Summary
When an agent raises a request on the customer portal on behalf of a customer, the customer name is displayed in Jira. This can get confusing.
 !Screen Shot 2021-10-05 at 11.52.51 am.png|thumbnail! 
h1. Suggested Resolution
Display the agent name instead of customer name in JIRA as 
"Agent name" raised the request vis *Portal*


h1. Workaround
There is no workaround
fields.summary: Customer name displayed in JIRA when agent raises a request on behalf of customer

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

We cannot edit/add/remove the filters showed in the Customer Portal
h3. Suggestion

As an administrator, being able to edit/add/remove the filters using the Customize option

!Screen Shot 2021-10-04 at 4.45.07 PM.png!
fields.summary: Ability to remove/edit filters showed in the customer Portal

fields.description: Same ability as in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1317 in Cloud version of JSM
fields.summary: Ability to copy request types to another Service Desk

fields.description:
Hello there,

Would it be possible to change the Group Picker behavior in the Create Issue screen via the Agent view so that it auto-searches for available groups in the same was as when editing an issue in the agent view.

Right now you have to click on the Group Picker icon below the field and then filter for your required group, select it and it populates the group picker.

Ideally, if would behave the same as the Edit Group picker behavior so that you click into the Group picker field and it display the first few groups, then you can type a few characters of the group name and it limits the list to those groups only.

This would much improve the user experience and make the group picker field behave the same as all the other "picker" style fields.
fields.summary: Group Picker Improvements on Create Issue (not via the Customer Portal)

fields.description:
Team,

I want to create new "Customer Service Management" project and I have raised free trial request for accessing above project. However, there is no response for the same. 

Please help.
fields.summary: Unable to create new trial project under JIRA Service Management

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Customers can't share a request with an e-mail address that does not belong to the Project if the Project's customer permission is set to +open to anyone on the web+.
h3. Suggested Solution

Create an option where the customer can invite a new customer to a closed Project without opening the project to anyone on the web.
h3. Workaround

Create a request type for the customer to add a new customer using their email, and using an automation to add service project customer, so it becomes available in the option share with.
fields.summary: Customers can't share a request with an e-mail address that does not belong to a closed Project

fields.description:
h3. Problem description
At the moment, eventhough the Insight attribute type are set to text, the return value for *LookupObjects* smart value can't use the [text formating|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/smart-values-text-fields/] to alter the value.

h3. Suggestion
Allow text formating to be use for lookupobjects smart value results.

h3. Workaround
Create a new variable for the lookupobjects smart value result. Then , use the text formating for the new variable :-
 !Screen Shot 2021-10-01 at 1.41.58 pm.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to use text formating for Insight lookupobjects smart value

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:

Currently, when an object is deleted, we are able to fetch the Object key deleted.
h3. Suggested Solution:

Able to get additional metadata when an object is deleted like object name and object type.
h3. Workaround:

No workaround
fields.summary: Required additional metadata when an object is deleted

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Deleting Object Type with Children Object Type(s) does not clean up import configuration where attributes were referring to the Children Object Type(s). This leads to 500 errors returned when attempting to view Import Mapping.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a schema with Parent OT, X with a Child OT, Y.
 # Create another Object Type, Z, with Attribute as Child OT, Y
 # Create an import configuration (can be any type, CSV/JSON/Discovery)
 # Create an import mapping of a Object Type, Z with attribute pointing to Y
 # Delete OT, X from schema (Y should be deleted too)
 # Refresh import configuration page and try expanding importing mapping created in 4

h3. Expected Results

Import mapping should be displayed with mapping of OT Z's attribute that was previously pointed to Y being removed.
h3. Actual Results

The below two exceptions are thrown in the splunk and FE receives a 500:
{noformat}
java.lang.NullPointerException: null
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.validation.ValidateImportSourceImpl.objectTypeAttributeBelongsToObjectType(ValidateImportSourceImpl.java:864)
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.validation.ValidateImportSourceImpl.objectTypeAttributeBelongsToObjectType(ValidateImportSourceImpl.java:851)
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.validation.ValidateImportSourceImpl.validateObjectTypeAttributeBelongsToObjectType(ValidateImportSourceImpl.java:805)
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.validation.ValidateImportSourceImpl.validateAttributeConfigurations(ValidateImportSourceImpl.java:592)
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.validation.ValidateImportSourceImpl.validateNonConformingConfiguration(ValidateImportSourceImpl.java:563)
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.validation.ValidateImportSourceImpl.validateImportSourceOTForExecution(ValidateImportSourceImpl.java:154)
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.impl.ImportSourceConfigurationServiceImpl.invalidateImportSourceOTIfInvalid(ImportSourceConfigurationServiceImpl.java:1419)
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.impl.ImportSourceConfigurationServiceImpl.updateImportSourceStatus(ImportSourceConfigurationServiceImpl.java:1343)
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.impl.ImportSourceConfigurationServiceImpl.loadImportSourceWithPassword(ImportSourceConfigurationServiceImpl.java:234)
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.impl.ImportSourceConfigurationServiceImpl.loadImportSource(ImportSourceConfigurationServiceImpl.java:221)
{noformat}
{code:java}
com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.common.exception.RuntimeInsightException: InsightRuntimeException: java.lang.NullPointerException; nested exception is: null
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.core.AbstractService.logAndConvertException(AbstractService.java:58)
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.impl.ImportSourceConfigurationServiceImpl.loadImportSourceWithPassword(ImportSourceConfigurationServiceImpl.java:237)
	at com.riadalabs.jira.plugins.insight.services.impl.ImportSourceConfigurationServiceImpl.loadImportSource(ImportSourceConfigurationServiceImpl.java:221)
{code}
h3. Workaround

No known workaround to recover the import configuration at this stage. Only way is to create new schema and/or import configuration and ensure to delete Children Object Type first when attempting to remove Object Types.

A current task is being created to fix this bug in the next couple of weeks.
fields.summary: Deleting Object Type with Children Object Type(s) will sometime break import configuration

fields.description:
*Current behaviour:*

It is not possible to change the template of an existing project. For e.g. a General Service Management project cannot be converted to an ITSM projec or vice versa.

*Expected behaviour:*

It'd be great to have this feature.

*Workaround:*

[Can I move my existing project to the new ITSM template?|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/can-i-move-my-existing-project-to-the-new-itsm-template/]
fields.summary: Ability to change the template of an existing project
